TITLE: The Case Against Appendectomies
SUMMARY: The appendix is turning out to contain biologically useful tissue that may help prevent nasty gastrointestinal ills.

TITLE: 5 Things Runners Can Do When Roads Are Icy
SUMMARY: Even if you have the right gear to handle the snow and ice, you can’t always trust that drivers will stay in control.

TITLE: Even a 10-Minute Walk May Be Good for the Brain
SUMMARY: Ten minutes of mild exercise can immediately alter how certain parts of the brain communicate and coordinate with one another and improve memory function.

TITLE: The Secret to Aging Well? Contentment
SUMMARY: Despite having many friends in their 70s, 80s and 90s, I’ve been far too slow to realize that how we respond to aging is a choice made in the mind, not in the gym.

TITLE: How Exercise Can Keep Aging Muscles and Immune Systems ‘Young’
SUMMARY: Older cyclists are not like most of the rest of us. They are healthier. They are, biologically, younger.
